page.title: 18The River Nene
page.content: The River Nene flows in a valley between Northampton and Wellingborough It is a navigable river with guillotine locks controlling the water flow. The last commercial barges used the river in 1969 when they brought bulk grain to Whitworths Mill. The river is being developed as a leisure resource for holiday boating, fishing and walking. On any week end during the fishing season the banks are lined with men dressed in old clothes and cowering beneath large green umbrellas. Last year the river was badly polluted when a brewery in Northampton released effluent into the river killing nearly all the fish. Access to the river in this area is limited placing a considerable strain on those living on the access roads.
